title: Laakarit Ilman Rajoja Data Analyst Sdsuu

title: Data Engineer Skspm
description: We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our DataOps team in KPMG Finland's Innovation & Technology unit. In this position, you'll work with our internal data and build our Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence capabilities.At KPMG we believe sharing the same values is key in career satisfaction, growth and feeling engaged. Our organizational culture is based on our values. We act with integrity, think boldly and are driven by a passion for excellence. We respect the individual and always work together for better.We are now looking for aData Engineerto join the KPMG Innovation & Technology team.The Innovation & Technology team ensures that our client facing applications, personnel and support functions have the platforms, tools and solutions needed to drive our business and enable client offerings with a digital touch. We make sure that the current platforms support our everyday business and look ahead for opportunities for developing our technology landscape to best serve the needs of the future.Our team is based in Helsinki, and this role requires working on a hybrid model, where it would be desirable to be present in the office at least three times a week.As a Data Engineer, you'll:Design and implement data pipelines tailored to business information requirementsCollaborate with the data architects to develop and maintain a business-driven data architecture that aligns with organizational goals and requirementsWork with our Integration Development Team to integrate data from KPMG and external systemsImplement security measures to safeguard sensitive data and ensure compliance with relevant regulationsSupport KPMG Finland's business initiatives by leveraging data from our platformStay updated on emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in cloud data engineeringShare knowledge and expertise through documentation, training, and mentorship to empower colleaguesYou are a strong candidate if you have:A degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, along with several years of relevant software development experienceExperience in data engineering within cloud environments, utilizing SQL and Python based solutionsUnderstanding of Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) conceptsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive attitude towards challengesExcellent communication and presentation abilities, enabling effective collaboration with both technical and non-technical stakeholdersProficiency in written and spoken EnglishThe following technical skills will also be beneficial:Experience with public cloud platforms in a DevOps or business development contextPractical experience of implementing data solutionsFamiliarity with Azure DatabricksFamiliarity with Power BIWhat we offer to youAn interesting field of work in a large international expert organization and the opportunity to participate in building the business of the future at KPMG. Your colleagues at the Innovation & Technology team are the top experts of the field, you have access to modern work tools and a wide selection of training. Working side-by-side with KPMG's broad spectrum of professionals will expand your practical understanding of technology and business. To ensure work-life balance, working with us is flexible so you can organize your work and, most importantly, the rest of your life as suits you the best. KPMG offers you versatile employee benefits and wide selection of services that support occupational well-being.This is a permanent full-time position, and the starting date is negotiable. The position is based in our office in Helsinki, T√∂√∂l√∂nlahdenkatu 3A.Do you want to make a difference with us?If you recognized yourself from the description, please fill out the application as soon as possible but no later thanMonday, March 31st. We encourage you to apply right away as our recruitment is ongoing and these positions will be filled when suitable candidates are found.For further information regarding the recruitment, please contact our recruitment team via email ***. For GDPR-reasons we do not accept applications by email.In case you require assistance with the recruitment process due to a disability, please reach out to us. If needed, we can provide reasonable accommodations.Please note that we do not accept recruitment agency inquiries regarding this open position. We kindly request that all applications be submitted directly to us. We also do not accept applications submitted through a recruitment agencyKPMG Finland is a purpose-led, values-driven organization and a proud equal opportunities employer. We're committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. We encourage you to come as you are, because we believe that a diverse workforce is key to our success and that our differences lead to stronger insights and innovation. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you unlock opportunities with us.

title: Software Engineer Sdsna
description: We are currently seeking for aSoftware Engineerto join our Data Applications team in the Data, AI & Integrations unit at DNA for permanent employment. The position is in Helsinki, but you can work remotely from anywhere in Finland according to our flexible work concept.DNA is recognised as an excellent employer, and we are sure that you will enjoy working with us. Below, you can find reasons why you should choose us for the next stage of your career!YOUR KEY JOB DESCRIPTIONAs a Software Engineer you will be working as part of the Data Applications team. Your key areas of responsibility will be to develop and maintain data-intensive software applications and services for various use cases, such as analytics & AI, marketing, customer care, sales or digital services. The applications may be, for example, data pipelines, APIs, integrations, UI tools or combinations of these.Our services are hosted on public cloud platforms, AWS and Google Cloud mainly, and widely utilize cloud-based services such as AWS Lambda, S3, and RDS. Primary programming languages used are Clojure, ClojureScript, and Python.In your daily work you will collaborate with your teammates but also with other development teams, analysts and other business stakeholders.PREFERRED COMPETENCE IN THIS ROLE:We are looking for a new colleague with suitable technical education and several years of hands-on experience in designing, implementing and maintaining production grade software services in a cloud environment. Expertise in software architecture design, developing data-intensive applications or front-end applications is an advantage.We hope you have previous experience with some of these tools and technologies:Clojure (or other functional/JVM based) and Python programming languagesSQL and other database tools, such as Postgres, Redis, AWS Dynamo, AWS RDSContainer tools, such as Docker, Kubernetes, AWS FargateREST APIsData warehouses such as Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift, SnowflakeOther software development and DevOps tools, such as Git, Jenkins, Terraform, AnsibleTo succeed in in the role, it is important that you have good communication skills, a hands-on approach to work, can work independently and can collaborate with various stakeholders. You also need to be able to communicate fluently in English. Ability to understand and communicate in Finnish is an advantage.WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:As stated in our employer promise we want to offer you a humane workplace where everyone can be one-of-a-kind as part of our community. Our values fast, bold and straightforward can be seen in our everyday lives. DNA strives to provide an excellent place to work, and we are constantly aiming to improve our practices as an employer to meet this goal.In this position you will be part of a supportive, self-directed community as part of a team of six experienced developers. Team members work partly remotely and partly in DNA's Ilmalanlinna office in Helsinki. We are strongly involved in Telenor's international cooperation, so you will also get to work with our international colleagues in the Nordic countries and elsewhere in the world.JOIN US - WE ARE ALREADY WAITING FOR YOU!Please apply via our recruitment system by March 23rd, 2025.If you have any questions regarding the role or DNA, please contact hiring manager Juha Niiranen by phone at ****** during the following calling hours: March 10th 14:30 - 15:30, March 13th 13:00-14:00 or March 14th 10:00-11:00. You can also be in touch via email at *** can submit your application in Finnish or English. This position requires an approved statement of security clearance.DNA IN A NUTSHELL:DNA is one of the leading telecommunications companies in Finland. Our purpose is to connect you to what matters most. We offer connections, services and devices for homes and workplaces, contributing to the digitalisation of society. Already for years, DNA customers have been among the world leaders in mobile data usage. DNA has about 3.6 million subscriptions in its fixed and mobile communications networks. The company has been awarded numerous times as an excellent employer and family-friendly workplace. In 2023, our total revenue was EUR 1 067 million and we employ about 1,700 people around Finland. DNA is a part of Telenor Group, a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics. More information:www.dna.fi, Facebook @DNA.fi and LinkedIn @DNA-Oyj.DNA's award-winning work culture is based on freedom and is built on trust. With us you have the freedom to shine as you are and achieve great things together with others. We appreciate employees from different kind of backgrounds regardless of age, gender, appearance, heritage, who they love or how they see the world.Click the links below to find out more about DNA and things that may be of interest to you.Employee BenefitsLearning & Career DevelopmentWork CultureEmployer PromiseFamily-friendly WorkplaceDiversityCorporate ResponsibilityFinanceInternationality

title: Data Engineer Sdsuu
description: We're looking for an experiencedData Engineer / Data Architectwho combines technical expertise with team player attitude. In this role, you'll design, develop, and manage data infrastructures for our clients while working with modern data platforms and data lakes.Innovative ideas, future-oriented strategies, and tailored IT solutionsadessois a European consulting company originating from Germany that has been operating in the market since 1997 and is present in 15 countries. Our Finnish unit was established in 2021, and we're a rapidly growing team. We help companies address challenges related to digital transformation, data, AI, and technology by providing solutions that combine technical aspects with a deep understanding of our clients' business needs.Our mission is to offer our employees interesting projects and an excellent work-life balance. We're proud that adesso has been awarded the Great Place to Work certification in Germany and Europe for several years, and we're bringing the same culture to Finland with a local twist. Decision-making at adesso is very local, so in this role, you'll also have the opportunity to influence the culture of adesso in Finland.What kind of role is this?We're looking for a Data Engineer / Data Architect to join our growing team. In this role, you'll design and manage data solutions for our clients while working in a startup-style organization that's backed by an international community of 11,000 professionals across Europe.As Data and AI are among adesso Group's main business areas, this position offers excellent opportunities for professional growth and international connections. We also work closely with our colleagues at 1001 Lakes, giving you the chance to collaborate with leading experts in European data sharing solutions.Key responsibilities and daily tasks:Designing and developing complex data platforms and effective solutionsCreating modern data platform architectures - from functional definitions to technological implementation in the cloud (Azure, AWS or GCP)Designing data architecturesModernization and optimization of data platformsSupporting proposals and client workshops focusing on data architecture, technology, and data engineering tasksWhy would you be suitable for this position?We're looking for an experienced professional who has successfully designed data architectures and built data platforms in public cloud environments. You're someone who enjoys solving complex problems, finds satisfaction in making data work efficiently, and can turn business challenges into practical solutions for our clients.Skills and characteristics:5+ years of Data Architecture / Data Engineering experience with public cloud environments especially Azure, AWS, or GCPExperience with most of these technologies: Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, Snowflake, SAS, Python, R, Fabric, Databricks, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, Spark, Kafka, SQL, ETL & ELT, and various databasesGood analytical and problem-solving skillsGood communication skills and team player attitudeFluent in EnglishTeam leading or project management experience is a plusWhy join adesso?business. people. technology.At adesso, we combine the security and support of an international group with the agility of a small local company. With us, you'll work with top professionals across various technologies, develop as a professional in an international environment, enjoy a flexible work culture and good work-life balance, and directly influence the company's growth and development. We value our employees' well-being and professional development, which is why we offer numerous training opportunities and regularly organize joint events, such as monthly breakfasts and after-work gatherings. Our office in Ruoholahti provides an inspiring work environment with a rooftop terrace and saunas.Additionally, at adesso, you can expect:Comprehensive benefits, including extensive occupational healthcare, insurance, and lunchFlexible hybrid work modelLow hierarchy and open communicationGreat local and international colleaguesTechnical communities across the Group for professional development and networkingInterested?Apply for the position by26.03.and tell us more about yourself. Don't wait too long ‚Äì we'll interview candidates during the application period and fill the position as soon as we find the right person.Recruitment process in short:1. Chat with Ilmi√∂'s recruiter: Discuss your background, skills, and interests2. Meeting with COO of adesso FinlandAnna W√§yrynenin Ruoholahti office3. Technical conversation with one of your future colleagues4. OfferThis job ad is published on behalf of adesso Finland by Ilmi√∂ Talent Agency. For additional information, contactAnton Virtanen, (Talent Partner @ Ilmi√∂),***

title: Data Engineer Scsom
description: Data EngineerLocation: Any twoday office (Helsinki, Tampere, Hyvink√§√§, Turku, Jyv√§skyl√§) with flexible remote working opportunities.Salary range:Base salary ranges from ******‚Ç¨ + additional bonus based on your customer invoicing.We are looking for Data Engineers in different stages of their careers (e.g. consultant to principal) to work on our customer projects creating sustainable and innovative data and analytics solutions that generate real business value.What the Data Engineering role is about at twoday?Data Engineers work as a part of the team on customer projects designing and developing modern and scalable data integration, data warehousing, and analytics solutions for multicultural customer companies in Finland and the Nordics in industries such as banking, retail, forestry, and manufacturing.Here at twoday Data Engineering is a wide role with different specialization areas, such as:Data Integrations and PipelinesData WarehousingData ArchitectureData ModelingAnalytics EngineeringYour role and focus areas will be shaped based on your previous experiences and interests.Who are you working with:Your role is based in twoday Finland's Data & AI business unit with approximately 200 employees in versatile roles related to modern data & analytics.Your colleagues & stakeholders:You'll belong to a customer team, which is your home base and team with whom you spend most of your working timeYou'll get the opportunity to be part of our technology practices. Technology practices are communities of professionals with similar backgrounds focused on competence and offering development.You'll have your own People Lead supporting your professional growth, career development, and wellbeing.You'll work closely with customers, who are mainly Finland's largest enterprises in both private and public sectors in all major industries.Key Hiring Criteria:We have opportunities for people in different stages of their careers, but since we are a consulting company, we expect that our Data Engineers can already work independently on our customer projects (after onboarding).Here are our key criteria for the Data Engineer role:Previous experience from some of the mentioned Data Engineering specialization areas,Basic understanding of data and analytics: you have worked with data and understand common practicalities,Experienced in SQL,General cloud capabilities in Azure or AWS/CGPCuriosity & willingness to learn,Capability to communicate in English, and with non-technical people.Things that will help you get started, but you can also learn them while working:Skills in technologies such as Snowflake, Dbt, Databricks, Microsoft Fabric,Programming skills (e.g. Python, Spark)Previous experience working in Agile environments, using methodologies like Scrum or KanbanWhat does success look like in this role?During the first 6 months, you have:Integrated into your new work community and are a great culture-add to our teamReached a billing ratio of at least 50%, or you are likely to reach it soonYour expertise has proven to be relevant to our customer projectsTo help you succeed in all of this, we will provide you with an onboarding plan, mentoring, trainings, certifications, and plenty of opportunities to get to know colleagues in and outside of work.What do we offer at twoday:Instead of rigid structures and hierarchy, you'll find twoday's Data & AI business unit to have a flat organization structure with plenty of flexibility in terms of how you arrange your work.Benefits and non-monetary things we offer:A good, standard set of benefits includes:Lunch, culture/sport/wellness benefitBike benefitGood healthcare package and Auntie mental wellbeing serviceGenerous choose your work equipment policyLearning support, including:Access to several online learning platforms like Udemy and DataCampCertifications with occasional certificate bonusesTrainings, conferencesRegular knowledge-sharing sessions with colleaguesOpportunity to invest in twoday's growth by becoming a co-ownerChoose your work location:Offices in Helsinki, Tampere, Hyvink√§√§, Jyv√§skyl√§ TurkuYou can work remotely flexiblyPlenty of free-time activities to enjoy with colleagues:Offsite trips - i.e. spring trip to TahkoCompany eventsMonthly office breakfastsHobby clubs: running, board games, padel, knitting...Diversity & InclusionAre you not meeting all the requirements listed? Studies have shown that women and other minority groups are less likely to apply for a job if they don't meet every qualification. We're dedicated to building a workplace of diversity and inclusion. If you are excited about this role but your previous experience does not match the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.Apply for this job:All you need to do is click"apply for the job"below the page and send us your application - we'll get back to you as soon as possible.We want to make applying easy for you, so you can apply with just your LinkedIn profile or CV. A cover letter is totally optional.Do you have any questions you would like us to answer before you send us your application?Contact Tech Lead Olli at ****** or via email olli.korpinen (at) twoday.com.Please note that we are only able to proceed with candidates with either Finnish citizenship or a valid work permit in Finland.Briefly about ustwoday is the premier digital transformation partner in Northern Europe with a global presence. With approximately 3,000 technologists, we collaborate with the most admired private and public sector organizations to deliver cutting-edge digital solutions. Our deep industry expertise includes Data & AI, software engineering, digital experiences, and business applications. Operating across the Nordics and Lithuania, our team generated a revenue of 280 million euros in 2023. Serving over 8,000 customers, facilitating their digital transformation journeys.Department Data & AI Locations Jyv√§skyl√§, Turku, Helsinki, Tampere, Hyvink√§√§ Remote status Hybrid

title: Data Engineer Data Platform Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves building in-going and out-going ETL processes between data systems, creating data models for Data Scientists, and assisting in feature engineering. You will also support in MLOps. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Develop and maintain ETL processes and ensure that they follow the harmonized data model and that re-usage of ETL scripts is optimized.Ensure that ETL processes and reporting solutions follow and support the company data privacy and security guidelines.Ensure data correctness and high availability according to business needs.Support in deploying and maintaining Machine Learning models in production.Work according to company policies and instructions.Make sure that agreed deadlines are kept according to the work amount estimates made.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A University degree holder in a relevant field.Experienced with 3-5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.Experienced in practical Data Engineer work.Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (Databricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.We are excited to hire individuals who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!We offer a hybrid work model to support your productivity.Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We are here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Data Engineer Sssii
description: MAKE YOUR STORY REALSiili is at the forefront of AI-powered development. Here, you will collaborate with AI-assisted developers and designers on projects that go beyond proof-of-concept, delivering real-world impact and innovation.Our own AI transformation uniquely positions us as the ideal partner to guide our clients through their AI journeys. We are currently supporting leading organizations like Microsoft and Yle in their AI transformations.AI represents the next industrial revolution, and Siili is ready to lead the charge in digital development, making the most of the transformative power of AI.Read more about our projects here.Interested in becoming a Data Engineer at Siili?ü¶îAs a Data Engineer you will work with our customers to solve real-life business challenges with modern data solutions. You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining data and analytics infrastructure. You will work in close co-operation with business and integrate data management and software into existing systems. You work together with various stakeholders and your daily tasks may include cloud computing, coding and data analysis. Basically, you are making great things possible!What are we looking for?üéØWe are looking for a data engineer with at least 3 years of work experience as a data engineer. It would be great if you can tick one or more of the following boxes:Hands-on coding experience with data-intensive coding solutions in languages such as Python, R, Scala, Node.js, C#, JavaYou have experience with Cloud platforms example Azure, AWS, Google CloudExperience or passion for learning data modelling methods like DataVault 2.0Experience with Data warehouse automationExperience or passion working with modern data warehouse solutions like SnowflakeExperience using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker for data analysis and reporting.Experience with SQL DatabasesInterest in Machine Learning is a great plusWhyto ChooseSiili?ü§ùWe offer you an interesting role where you can make a difference in our customers business. You have opportunity to choose from different tracks how you want to develop your skills and role it could be developing skills in BI & Analytics, AI, Data warehousing, Integrations, architecture or developing role more in to delivery lead way.We provide a culture and environment withJoy, AmbitionandHumanetouch. This means that we continuously organize different kinds of activities and gatherings, strive to enable exciting projects with learning opportunities, and continuously work on creating a work environment that is inclusive and psychologically safe for everyone to express themselves.You will have the opportunity to work with the best colleagues (Siilis) on interesting client projects. You will never be bored:we believe in continuous growth, meaning you can always deepen your expertise alongside our Data Science experts. Being a Siili means you get to work in diverse teams while still managing your own work - we trust you!A variety ofgreat fringe benefits; such as extensive healthcare, flexible working hours, snacks, inhouse coach, SiiliX Share program, employee bike benefit, and company-sponsored massage.Discover more about our benefits here , and get to know our team through these inspiring career stories . For a closer look at our vibrant company culture, we also recommend following us on Instagram .Shall we get to know each other better?üí¨At Siili, we don't have interviews, we have meetings. With two meetings, we ensure together that both our goals and expectations are aligned, laying the foundation for a great future together.We hope to receive applications from individuals with various backgrounds, including different ages, genders, and cultural or minority groups. Please let us know if we can adjust our meeting according to your needs. We aim to consider individual needs and neurodiversity in our recruitment process, and to make meetings as comfortable as possible for everyone.WE MAKE IT REAL

title: Data Engineer Python Developer Sdsuu
description: Luxid is a forward-thinking tech & digital marketing agency committed to our values: driven, trailblazing, resourceful, and sincere. We Luxidians are a team of creative thinkers, strategists, data analysts, developers, technologist, writers, designers, filmmakers, and virtual world builders. With over 30 years of experience in delivering marketing and commerce solutions, we help our clients drive sales with seamless customer journeys and flawless website operations.We have different tech roles in our Data & Development unit so if you are a passionate future developer, data engineer or data scientist interested in marketing and customer behaviour, we might have a place for you! With us you will get to collaborate with cross-functional teams to create robust, scalable, and user-friendly solutions. Working with world-class clients in a multi-tech and multi-code environment, you have a great opportunity to expand your professional expertise. You get to see how data moves ‚Äúunder the hood‚Äù and learn how to guide multinational clients through marketing analytics and support their data-driven culture.Examples of the skills you would get to develop and platforms you would familiarize yourself with:‚Ä¢ Python‚Ä¢ SQL‚Ä¢ BI Development: Working with data from various platforms (e.g., marketing automation, paid media, CRM) using modern data integration & centralization tools & Developing user-friendly BI solutions beyond channel metrics (Power BI focus)‚Ä¢ Digital analytics tools (Semrush, Goole Analytics, etc.)‚Ä¢ Cloud platforms/data integration tools (GCP, Azure, AWS ‚Äì Dataddo, Supermetrics etc.)‚Ä¢ JavaScript (React)Grow into the role through the Code & Cyber Academy Recruitment TrainingThe position will be filled through the Code & Cyber Academy Recruitment Training program. The purpose of the five-month recruitment training is to enhance your skills through high-quality training days and on-the-job learning. The goal of the recruiting training is for the participants to be employed by the companies involved at the end of the program. To participate the training program you need to have Finnish language skills at least level B1.1.Read more about the program: https://www.saranen.fi/tyonhakijalle/toihin-koulutuksesta/codecyberacademyThe application deadline isMarch 24, 2025, but it‚Äôs a good idea to apply as soon as possible, as we will start interviews as soon as we find suitable candidates!The application process is two-step:1.Complete the electronic applicationthrough the employment services and ensure that your job-seeking status is active.2.Fill in your details in the Saranen system. The information from this skills profile will be used to present your expertise to the recruiting companies.Further information: Emilia Ropponen, ***, ******. The best way to reach Emilia is by email or phone during calling hours on Mondays at 2-3 pm and Fridays at 2-3 pm (excl. 17.3. and 21.3.).Code & Cyber Academy Recruitment Training is carried out in cooperation with recruiting companies and the Espoo Employment Area. The program is mainly aimed at unemployed jobseekers or jobseekers at risk of unemployment in the Uusimaa region, whose are customer of employment services. The training is free of charge for the participant and it is possible to receive unemployment benefit and expense allowance for the duration of the program.

title: Azure Data Engineer Scsom

Our company combines a human-centered work culture, strong technical expertise, and the flexibility to shape your own role. We help our clients leverage data for business development and gain a competitive edge. Using Microsoft Azure technology, we build intelligent, scalable, and secure cloud-based solutions. We are passionate about data, and for us, meaningful work and quality are at the core of everything we do.As an Azure Data Engineer, you will work on diverse and technically demanding cloud projects. You will be responsible for designing and implementing data platforms and analytics solutions, leveraging the latest technologies and AI-driven capabilities. title: Senior Data Engineer Snsok
description: JOB DESCRIPTIONNokia Technologies is licensing Nokia intellectual property, including patents, technologies, and the Nokia brand, building on Nokia's continued innovation and decades of R&D leadership in technologies deployed in virtually all connected devices used today. The Investment Management team is responsible for driving and coordinating strategy development, investment and financial planning, as well as governance and reporting for the Patent Portfolio organization. The Patent Portfolio organization manages Nokia's industry-leading patent portfolio and is dedicated to enhancing value from Nokia's patents and R&D efforts.RESPONSIBILITIESDesign and implement robust data storage solutions that meet our needs for scalability and efficiency, ensuring that data is easily accessible and reliableDevelop and maintain seamless data pipelines that facilitate the flow of information across various systems, empowering your teammates with timely and accurate dataCollaborate to create innovative data solutions that integrate and join diverse data sources, supporting informed decision-making throughout the organizationDraw data insights to drive strategic decision-making in collaboration with the wider teamQUALIFICATIONSYou have:5+ years of professional hands-on experience from end-to-end data engineeringStrong command of SQL and PythonBusiness acumen: ability to apply data insights to drive strategic decisions and improve business outcomesSelf-guided approach, eagerness to take ownership, and enough seniority to navigate and organize work across different cross-functional stakeholdersExcellent communication skills in English: ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear explanations for both technical and non-technical stakeholdersBachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related fieldIt would be nice if you also had:Previous experience from working with and understanding financial dataCertifications: Azure Data Engineer, Fabric Analytics Engineer, or DatabricksFamiliarity with Azure services like Data Lake, Data vault, Stream Analytics, and other big data technologies (e.g., Kafka, Spark)Previous experience with data visualization tools, for example Tableau or PowerBIPrevious experience from developing simple UI interfaces to interact with data modelsPrevious experience from working with patent and/or patenting related dataABOUT USCome create the technology that helps the world act togetherNokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people's lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to workWhat we offerNokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employerNokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:One of the World's Most Ethical Companies by EthisphereGender-Equality Index by BloombergWorkplace Pride Global BenchmarkAt Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia's employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.ABOUT THE TEAMNokia Technologies is licensing Nokia intellectual property, including patents, technologies, and the Nokia brand, building on Nokia's continued innovation and decades of R&D leadership in technologies deployed in virtually all connecteddevices used today. Come join us and make an impact!

title: Senior Data Engineer Online Data Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves overseeing data engineering activities in your responsibility area, such as Online Data Products. You will build data processing frameworks, work with data architects, and strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Provide senior-level contribution to a team that is responsible for the design, deployment, and maintenance of the business's data platforms.Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business.Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and lead partnerships with other Data and Analytics teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A master's or bachelor's degree holder in computer science.Experienced with more than 5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.Experienced in leading Data Engineer work.Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (DataBricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.Knowledge from GraphQL APIs / Rest APIs is a plus.We are excited to hire individuals who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

If you're passionate about driving growth in the mobile gaming industry through data, engineering, and applied data science, we'd love to hear from you! We're looking for a talentedData Engineerto help us make our mission a reality. This role can be based in Helsinki or London.TeamThe Marketing Data Team is an integral part of Supercell's broader Analytics organization, enabling our games to measure, analyze, and optimize the impact of their investments. Through data and technology solutions, we help to enable sustainable growth at scale, ensuring Supercell remains among the top 10 mobile game publishers worldwide.Our team delivers a wide range of services across Supercell, including data modeling, attribution, measurement, analytics, and data science support to help with data-driven decision-making.JobWe are seeking a highly skilled Data or MLOps Engineer to join our Marketing Data team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data engineering and MLOps to help optimize performance marketing budgets by building scalable data pipelines, ensuring robust and reliable data models, and automating the team's workflows to enhance efficiency and productivity.You will work closely with central data and game teams to create, develop, and maintain marketing data pipelines while also being responsible for deploying and managing the team's data applications, including ML models.You should have a deep understanding of modern data modeling principles, analytics engineering, and the MLOps tech stack. Experience leading data engineering initiatives is a strong plus, along with a solid grasp of the unique challenges and demands of performance marketing, user acquisition technologies, and managing data at scale in mobile gaming companies.ResponsibilitiesDesign and develop scalable data models, pipelines, and transformations to support user acquisition efforts.Own and manage the team's data ETLs, ensuring high data quality, consistency, and reliability.Deployment and maintenance of ML models at scale. Business data science experience is a plus.Build and maintain automation tools that empower Analysts and Data Scientists to support UA managers and media buyers in their daily work.Ensure marketing data engineering priorities are aligned with the company's data ecosystem development.Collaborate with the team to further develop and enhance our marketing technologies and data capabilities.Role Requirements5+ years of experience in the design, development, and maintenance of data products and applications.Expert knowledge of PySpark, Python and SQL.Proven track record of maintaining large-scale ETL processes.Strong familiarity with the AWS data stack and experience with large-scale data warehouse technologies (we use Databricks).Knowledge of CI/CD and data orchestration tools.Ability to comfortably work in an international, fast-paced, challenging, and stimulating organization.A passion for gaming and enhancing player experiences. Proactive mindset.Benefits and CompensationLuring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.Read MoreAbout SupercellWe are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released six games globally - Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale, Brawl Stars, and Squad Busters .To make six games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality.Our mission is to create great games that as many people as possible play for years and that are remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we put together the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence to succeed.Read MoreYou Might Love It Here...If you love games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams that have the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games, and the company.We know it takes more than trust and independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed and have fun while at it.Read MoreYou Are Not Your Job TitleWorking with us means you won't need to focus on chasing titles or climbing ladders. We've decided that our internal job titles don't include prefixes like senior, junior, principal, or director. Instead, we embrace our non-hierarchical culture, allowing us to concentrate on what truly matters: doing what's best for our players. Recognition isn't tied to your job title, nor does your title define the impact you can have.For hiring purposes, we do use industry-standard job titles to help attract talent. When it comes to public-facing spaces like LinkedIn, we trust and encourage everyone to select a title that feels most appropriate for them.Read MoreThis position is in Helsinki, but you're not?Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to ensure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you bring along. In addition to cats and dogs, we've even relocated a horse.Read MoreNot sure if you should apply?Do it! You might feel like you don't tick all the listed requirements with stellar scores. That's fine! We're here to help you succeed. Also, we're happy to learn about any specific accommodations you might require to fully engage in our recruitment process.And here's a video about what we do. (Best enjoyed with salmiakki and rye bread)

title: Data Engineer Financial Data Services Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves building in-going and out-going ETL processes between data systems, creating data models for Data Scientists, and assisting in feature engineering. You will also support in MLOps. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Develop and maintain ETL processes and ensure that they follow the harmonized data model and that re-usage of ETL scripts is optimized.Ensure that ETL processes and reporting solutions follow and support the company data privacy and security guidelines.Ensure data correctness and high availability according to business needs.Support in deploying and maintaining Machine Learning models in production.Work according to company policies and instructions.Make sure that agreed deadlines are kept according to the work amount estimates made.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A University degree holder in a relevant field.Experienced with 3-5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.Experienced in practical Data Engineer work.Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (Databricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.We are excited to hire an individual who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We are here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Data Engineer Snsit
description: BrieflyPositionSenior Data EngineerLocationHelsinki or TampereSkillsData architecture, data engineering, cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), databases, data pipelines, software engineering (e.g. Python, Scala, Clojure)KuvausAre you passionate about data engineering and data architecture? Would you like to build solutions that create actual business value? At Nitor, we help our clients to succeed with data.üßë‚ÄçüöÄYour future roleAs a Senior Data Engineer at Nitor, your aim is to help our customers extract business value from data with a pragmatic approach, focusing on solving their challenges with the right tools. Your responsibilities might include creating data-intensive applications, automating and orchestrating data pipelines, and simplifying complex technical entities into more common-sense solutions.Communication with the customer is crucial, and training our customer‚Äôs experts to use and maintain the provided solution is also an intriguing part of your job.Our customer projectsare typically challenging yet professionally rewarding. The projects provide an experienced Senior Data Engineer with the possibility to widely utilize and deepen their skill set. The duration of the projects usually ranges between one year and multiple years, depending on your preferences. Our data business unit Nitor Insight, established in 2018, is a tight-knit and startup-like community with an exceptionally high level of data know-how.‚úÖ What makes you successful as a Senior Data Engineer at Nitor?Several years of previous work experience in software development (we often work with Python, sometimes you might encounter Scala or Clojure in a client project). Consulting experience is a bonus but not a strict requirement.Experience of cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, and/or GCP) and relational databasesMastering the tools needed to create data-intensive applications (e.g. Spark, Kafka)Ability to automate and manage data pipelines and simplify complex technical entities into more common-sense solutionsYou possess a consultative and customer-centric mindsetProfessional proficiency in Finnish is considered an advantageMost importantly: you are passionate about data engineering, and you actively follow the newest developments in the industryüèÜ Why should you choose Nitor?A set of benefits that makes a differenceIn addition to meaningful projects and customized possibilities for professional development, we offer you a profound set of employee benefits. Nitor is built in a way that it can support your career development, sustainable work pace, and well-being.Here are some examples of our employee benefits:You can use 10% of your work time for your professional development however you choose, and your employer will support it.Would you like to participate in an exciting event in your field? You can use up to five workdays a year for training or conference trips anywhere in the world.You will have your personal, monthly updated "iron bank" consisting of 7.100‚Ç¨ which you can freely use to acquire preferred work tools and home office supplies.You will get full holidays from the beginning of your employment, no matter what time of the year you start.Full culture and sports benefits, massage benefit, and commuting and bicycle benefitsA 500-2000‚Ç¨ bonus for each professional certificate you completeAn extensive set of health benefits with health insurance, covering special healthcare, dental care, and psychological support, among othersWe cherish our sense of community with our yearly employee trips (we have been, e.g., to Pisa, Berlin, Vienna, Edinburgh, and Dubrovnik, as well as the skiing centers of the North), seasonal events, and weekly get-togethers and breakfasts. You're welcome to join our running club, wine tasting, movie nights, HIIT training, or board game club, among others!Our way of working is grounded in trust, openness, and mutual respect; each Nitorean brings their unique quality to the company. We value and cherish our differences and the added value this brings to our customers.About your future employerAt Nitor, we don‚Äôt just build digital solutions; we create lasting success stories in collaboration with our clients. Sustainability is at the heart of our approach, ensuring that the systems, communities, environments, and processes we develop stand the test of time. This is what we call sustainable digital development.Our 250+ experts operate across Helsinki, Tampere, and Stockholm, combining diverse talents to deliver meaningful impact. Recognized as a Great Place to Work and awarded Finland‚Äôs Most Magnetic Employer Brand (read more), we take pride in our employee-driven culture and genuine commitment to our people's growth. We don‚Äôt just work together; we grow together. Your ideas and expertise will have a real impact, shaping both Nitor‚Äôs future and your career.Our vision is clear: to be the top choice for professionals in the field, driven by the happiness and empowerment of our people and customers. As a benchmark for customer satisfaction in the IT industry, Nitor continues to achieve growth and deliver outstanding customer results (read how dedication fuels our growth).üèñNitor's recruitment processOur recruitment process reflects our values and is a clear dialogue with four stages. You will have the possibility to meet at least four Nitoreans during the process. We offer you everything you need to know when deciding on your next workplace.1. Get to know Nitor: We map what is most important to you in your career. Our People Partner and our Principal Data Scientist / Managing Director will tell you about Nitor, our projects, and what your work at Nitor could look like.2. A technical interview: You will meet two of our consultants, who will form an understanding of the strengths and extent of your expertise. You will also gain first-hand knowledge of our projects and Nitor as an employer.3. Open questions: We double-check that you have all the answers to your possible questions. We specify your future role at Nitor and prepare the basis for your upcoming job offer.4. Presenting the offerSounds promising? Would you like to join our community of data professionals, coders, designers, and agile coaches and get to enjoy a creative and bureaucracy free working culture? Submit your application, let us know why Nitor and consulting would be an interesting next career step for you, and let's talk more!Also, please note that you will need to be authorized to work in Finland or Sweden in order to proceed in our recruitment process.Nitorilla √§√§nesi kuullaanNitor haluaa tarjota tekij√∂illeen parhaan mahdollisen paikan kasvaa ja kehitty√§ alansa ammattilaisena. Nitorilla saat olla oma itsesi ja rakennat urapolkusi osaamisen ja kiinnostuksesi mukaan.Haastavat ty√∂teht√§v√§t ja ty√∂kavereiden sparraus yll√§pit√§v√§t oppimisen iloa. Voit osallistua my√∂s kiinnostaviin koulutuksiin, tapahtumiin ja konferensseihin Nitorin tukemana. Halutessasi p√§√§set k√§ytt√§m√§√§n ty√∂aikaa uusien asioiden opiskeluun, Nitorin kehitt√§miseen organisaationa tai vaikka yleist√§ hyv√§√§ edist√§viin projekteihin.Suomen ja Euroopan parhaimpien ty√∂paikkojen joukkoon useana vuonna valittu Nitor on sitoutunut kehitt√§m√§√§n kulttuuriaan jatkuvasti paremmaksi yhdess√§. L√§pin√§kyvyys on t√§rkeimpi√§ ty√∂t√§mme ohjaavia tapojamme - meill√§ √§√§nesi kuullaan.Lis√§√§ kysymyksi√§?Laita viesti People Partner Ella Raskilalle. H√§n vastaa sinua askarruttaviin kysymyksiin. Emme rekrytoi massoja, vaan yksil√∂ kerrallaan. Niinp√§ jokainen rekrytointiprosessimme on my√∂s yksil√∂llinen. Haluamme, ett√§ voit mutkattomasti tutustua Nitoriin ja l√∂yd√§t itsellesi oikean paikan.

title: Senior Data Engineer Scsom
description: GPV is on a journey towards implementing a modern Data Platform and we want you to join us!Maybe you are currently working as a consultant but are tired of time registration and having to focus on five different projects at the same time? Or maybe you are stuck as an in-house developer at a place where things are standing still, and you feel like you being there doesn't make a difference? Then join GPV for a greenfield project where we are moving from a mix of on-prem technologies to a modern setup using Microsoft Fabric.Your roleAs a Data Engineer you will initially support our on-prem Microsoft data solutions, before transitioning into a key player in our future Fabric solution. Expect that your primary work the first 6 months will be focused on learning our legacy Microsoft platforms, taking over the responsibility from a colleague moving to a different IT position. The role will then be a split with approximately 50/50 time on maintaining and optimising the old platforms, and developing the new solution in Fabric with the knowledge you have gained in the first half year.GPV currently have several legacy ERP systems due to mergers, and your job is to secure reporting in the data platforms on top of these systems. Further we are in the process of rolling out D365FO with the first pilot site going live at the end of 2025. You will be an important part of this project, where the new Data Platform should contain the needed reporting at go-live. For both the existing and new platform you will be part of the complete process from requirement gathering with end-users, extracting source data, data modelling and building the cubes or semantic models in PowerBI.What we offerYou will be part of the team that transitions GPV into a digitized future, going from a complex setup with several different on-prem data platforms to a more streamlined setup in Microsoft Fabric.We offer a job where you can really make a difference and be challenged, while at the same time having fun with your colleagues.You will be offered a competitive salary that matches your qualifications and there are of course the standard things you would expect from the workplace, like mobile phone, internet provided at your home and a good canteen. Further there are social activities with local colleagues.To support learning there are possibilities to attend relevant conferences and take relevant certifications, to help your transition from the on-prem tech-stack to the Fabric experiences.We are looking for a senior data engineer with a relevant educational background and 5+ years of experience, with a focus on data solutions on the on-prem Microsoft tech-stack and an eager to learn new cloud tools together with skilled colleagues. You speak and communicate fluently in English.You are probably humble by nature and cannot checkoff all the requirements below, but hopefully there are a lot of known topics and you are able to quickly learn the rest because you are curious and like to explore.Microsoft T-SQL, with good knowledge of writing efficient SQL code, defining views and stored procedures, looking at execution plans, etc.SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), with hands-on experience of extracting data from different source systems, develop ELT logic and deployment to SQL servers, using the SQL Agent for orchestration and monitoring of nightly loadsSQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), having developed logic preferably both in tabular cubes (DAX) and multidimensional cubes (MDX)SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), with good understanding of how to build reports, deployment and access managementData Modelling, using SQL code and the Kimball methodology to build facts and dimensionsAzure DevOps, where Git repositories is a natural part of the development processCommunication skills, because your job is to collaborate with both the rest of the Data Team and in general with end-users in the business, in an international setupFurther it is beneficial if some of the following topics are also in your toolbelt:Microsoft PowerBI, building reports and the underlying semantic models (DAX), maybe utilizing external tools like Tabular EditorMicrosoft Fabric(excluding PowerBI), either hands-on from a project or self-learning with some of the components. Maybe you have or are planning to take the DP-600 certification.Azure Services, that are used in batch related data solutions (ADF, SQL, KeyVault, Storage Accounts, etc.)Power Platform, using Power Apps and Power Automate, both on its own and in combination with PowerBI reportsD365FO, understanding of the data model from the ERP system where you have preferably worked with data modelling and reporting on topGPV is an international company and the 3 members of the Data Team are located in 2 different countries. You will be working in a hybrid setup, partly from our office in Vantaa, Finland or Piestany, Slovakia and partly from home. We expect that the transportation from your place of residence to the office to be a maximum of 60 minutes. You will also cooperate with our external partners that support our journey, where they have provided the Fabric framework and needed support in the project.Learn more about GPV in our website: https://gpv-group.com/#LI-JH1

title: Senior Data Engineer Analytical Data Services Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves overseeing data engineering activities in your responsibility area, such as Analytical Data Products. You will build data processing frameworks, work with data architects, and strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Provide senior-level contribution to a team that is responsible for the design, deployment, and maintenance of the business's data platforms.Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business.Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and lead partnerships with other Data and Analytics teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A master's or bachelor's degree holder in computer science.Experienced with more than 5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.Experienced in leading Data Engineer work.Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (DataBricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.We are excited to hire ian ndividual who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Data Engineer Sfsut
description: Join us!If you're ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you've come to the right place. We're always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.As a Senior Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients' data!We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It's all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Senior Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible to a governmental organization.We are excited to find a talented Senior Data Engineer who is already based in the Helsinki or Tampere area and eager to collaborate with our team and customers. We offer a hybrid working mode that allows for flexibility, but it is important that the candidate is located close by one of our Finland offices to ensure seamless collaboration. Please kindly note that, at this time, we are unable to offer relocation opportunities, or we will need to be highly selective in considering such requests.Here are some practical things we'd love to see in your back pocketSeveral years of work experience in data engineeringExperience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent in Finnish and English.CompensationYour complete compensation package will be discussed in detail during the recruitment process. Our salary model is designed to offer a range of levels based on three factors: skills, responsibilities and impact. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment where every employee has the opportunity to thrive and advance in their career and become better versions of themselves.During the initial interview round, we will discuss the salary range for this position. We offer a fixed salary with the possibility of performance-based bonuses and additional benefits.Next stepsIf this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.Our application form is about as easy as it gets. All you need to do is enter your contact information and upload your attachments. We'd love to see a CV, and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice. If you need some inspiration, read ourtipson how to stand out from the other applicants. You can also submit links to your LinkedIn and/or GitHub profile or your portfolio, as well as share other attachments relevant to the application.After we receive your application, we will reach out to you. Those selected for the interview phase can look forward to an initial discussion that will help us get to know you better, and you to get more info about life at Futurice. This is followed by an in-depth talk with your potential future colleagues to dive deeper into your professional skills. Finally, there's a general chat to discuss things like your potential future projects. It is also worth mentioning that reference calls are an integral part of our recruitment process.Working at FuturiceEver since Futurice was founded, we've been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We've put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean -take a look here, check our Culture Handbook 2.0 and learn more about some of ourpeople through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our officeshere!At Futurice,new joinersare not expected to fit into a specific mold - people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there's power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about ourDE&I commitment and efforts here.We're FuturiceWe are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.
