title: Data Scientist Scsom
description: About us:Smartbi is a leading data and AI consultancy, helping businesses navigate the complex landscape of AI adoption and transformation. Our expertise spans end-to-end design and implementation of AI and advanced analytics solutions for enterprises - from opportunity assessments and solution design to full-scale AI implementation. As organizations seek to harness the potential of data and AI, we are looking to grow our core team of skilled Data Scientists.About the role:As a Data Scientist at Smartbi, you will drive innovation by developing and deploying advanced machine learning models and data-driven solutions to solve real-world problems for our industrial clients. You will work closely with data engineers, project managers, and clients to deliver predictive analytics that optimize business operations.Key responsibilities:Build and deploy machine learning models for various industrial use cases.Analyze and process large datasets to generate actionable insights.Collaborate with a wide variety of stakeholders to ensure succesfull implementation.Communicate complex data results and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Contribute to improving ways of working for our clients, ensuring AI and data-centric solutions are seamlessly integrated into their daily operations.What we offer:The opportunity to work on challenging AI projects with tangible real-world impact across industries, collaborating with multinational clients.A supportive and innovative working environment that invests in your professional development.Flexible working environment - regarding remote work, for instance.International team and projects (we have offices in Finland and the US).Strong sense of community in our team, with a range of events and activities to join.Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science or machine learning.Strong analytical and mathematical understanding.Proficiency in Python, SQL, and experience with Azure cloud platform.Experience with machine learning and data science tools such as Pandas, NumPy, PyTorch.Familiarity with APIs, Git, and good coding practices.Skills in data visualization using tools like Matplotlib and Seaborn.Strong understanding of MLOps concepts.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.Fluency in English; Finnish is a plus.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Scsom
description: We are now looking for aBusiness IntelligenceAnalystto strengthen and support our data & analytics function underAdapteo Group IT. This is an exciting opportunity to come and join us on ourgrowth journey and our mission of building adaptable societies.You'll be joining a close-knit team of six, includingtwo Analysts, a Data Engineering Architect, an Integration Specialist, and ourteam manager, Aleksi.About the roleIn this role you gather and analyze data from multipledata sources using modern business intelligence applications and platforms suchas Snowflake, SnapLogic and Tableau. You will deliver result by helping improvethe way we utilize data in our day-to-day business by automating manual tasks,automating reporting, and providing insights that supports our business leaders.You will be working closely with Adapteo's data superusers and providing necessarytraining and support in everything data related. As part of Adapteo's datateam, you will collaborate within group IT as well as Adapteo's business units'management in varied tasks, where you can make an impact from day one.This position is located in our Finnish head officebased in Vantaa. Some traveling to other Adapteo officesmay be required.Responsibilities:Develop and manage business intelligence solutions for the organizationProvide and improve reporting from Adapteo's business systems to improve business processes and provide visibility to business leadersCollaborate with IT team members for the purpose of driving analytics and data adaption within the organizationAnalyze business requirements and converting them into data productsCreate and maintain documentation that includes the design, requirements, project management information and user manuals for the organizationTrain, support, and coach personnel in our business units across Europe in data related mattersWhat we expect from you:Master's degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experienceAt least 2 years' experience working with data and analyticsGreat understanding of technology-driven business intelligence toolsStrong business analysis skills and data visualization skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Finnish, Swedish would be a plusAbility of working effectively both independently and as part of a teamStructured, driven, committed, and with strong attention to detailAdditionally, previous experience in the construction industry or experience working with databases and programming languages such as SQL, R, or similar would be considered a bonus. Familiarity with ERP systems and knowledge of finance and business controlling processes would also be advantageous.Previous working experience with Tableau is considered as a big advantage.What we offerFlexible and collaborative culture with low hierarchyWe are supporting each other and sharing ideas and expertise with our colleaguesEnvironment is allowing and everyone has a chance to influence the success of our business and processesMeaningful job in highly motivated and skilled team in international organizationPossibility to develop your own skillset and expertise while at the same time influence Adapteo's analytics landscape and the way we work in the futureExtensive employee benefits including for example occupational healthcare package, lunch, culture and sports benefitsInterested?Please apply for this role by clicking on the apply now button. We will review applications continuously.

title: Senior Backend Engineer Content Experiences Scsom
description: THE ROLE & THE TEAMZalando eCommerce Platform (ZCP) is a growing multi-disciplinary group of 500+ data scientists, engineers, business developers, and product managers across Helsinki, Zurich, Dublin and Berlin working to inspire each individual customer with meaningful fashion moments beyond transactions in a very personalized way.. The team directly impacts on what our 50+ million active customers see during their visit at our Fashion Store (e.g.: www.zalando.fi). The team aim is to provide the most relevant, engaging user experience for each customer. We do this by combining Machine Learning driven personalization and business driven systems driving content selection decisions.To further strengthen our efforts to improve our platform offering, we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer striving on the ideas of finely crafted software, operational excellence and building a world class platform.As aSenior Backend Engineerin this team you will be working on high quality key services. You will drive discovery, design and development for our new initiatives and collaborate with our stakeholders and downstreams.WHAT WE'D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)Full development cycle: Discovery, design, develop, deploy, operate, monitor and improve important software solutions that impact millions of customersGet onboard our tech stack of Scala, DynamoDB, Redis, PostgreSQL and Kubernetes.Specifying, planning, developing, maintaining and operating microservices using REST APIs and cloud-native technologiesParticipate in planning, writing design documents, code reviews and our lean ritualsCollaborate with many Applied Scientists and Data Engineers across different locationsWork together with product management to clarify contribution to company initiativesTogether with your peers, represent the team when reacting to incoming requests, mail and chat communicationsConsistently ship working, testable, maintainable, readable code/data to production in small and safe iterations. The solutions are performant, scalable and fulfill the set SLOs of the productMaking a positive impact on our engineering culture, encouraging knowledge sharing and driving technical discussions within the team and beyondKeep learning and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate fasterWE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IFYou have solid knowledge of JVM based language(s) (Scala, Java, Kotlin), willingness and interest in learning Scala 3 (including libraries like Cats Effect & ZIO) and knowledge of software patterns and paradigms like continuous integration, test automation and deployment pipelines.You have experience in specifying, planning, developing, maintaining and operating large scale microservices using REST API (OpenAPI), GraphQL, Cloud Platforms (AWS, Kubernetes), PostgreSQL.High level knowledge or interest in data engineering and familiarity with DAGs, data pipelines, S3, Superset, Databricks, or Airflow is a plus.Good skills in SQL and Python is a plusYou have good communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working in an international and diverse environment with a positive no-job-is-beneath you attitude as a team playerYou are self-motivated and have a proactive mindset with a passion for continuous improvement.You have problem-solving skills and ability to apply logical and analytical thinking to complex problemsOUR OFFERCentrally located and accessible office in Kamppi, Helsinki city center, with diverse working and entertainment spaces and healthy snacks and drinks available.Hybrid work model of up to 60% remote work and flexible working times.40% Zalando shopping discount for employees, employee share shop, bike benefit, and Edenred benefits for lunch, sports and culture, commuting and massage.Extensive occupational health care and child care benefits.Additional holidays and volunteering time off.Supportive and active international community of colleagues for onboarding, mentoring, continued learning and for having fun through diverse offering of meetups and events, knowledge guilds and Employee Resource Groups with open source commitment.Relocation assistance for internationals.Learn all about Zalando and our values here: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us. For more information about our office and teams in Helsinki, please visit: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/where-we-work/helsinkiPlease note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you're great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusionOur employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

title: Senior Solutions Architect Aws Ags Emea Field North Scsom
description: Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate? Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Finland and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customers validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploying workloads on AWS. Deliver thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.Come build the future with us.AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.About the teamDiverse ExperiencesAWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.Why AWS?Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.Inclusive Team CultureAWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.Mentorship & Career GrowthWe're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.Work/Life BalanceWe value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS- Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.- Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience- Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders- Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges- English business level communication skills written and verbalPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS- Computer Science or Maths background highly desired- Working knowledge of software development practices and technologies highly desired- AWS Certification, eg. AWS Solutions Architect Associate- Finnish or Estonian business level communication skills written and verbalAmazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice ( https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page ) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Senior Tech Lead Data Platform Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions team! This role involves leading the Data Platform Team in DCO. You will be responsible for the data platform that supports multiple data domains, providing a unified governance solution for all data and AI assets, including files, tables, machine learning models, and dashboards in the Consumer Solutions' Databricks Lakehouse Platform & Gen AI (Data Intelligence Platforms). You will actively contribute to data democratization across Consumer Solutions and Fortum. Your role is to understand changes in markets, competition, technology, and customer behavior and turn them into decisions and execution that support all our teams to succeed. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Leading the data engineering team and collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery.Ensure technical excellence, using the right tools and technologies to support the team to deliver faster.Be responsible for overall system availability and compliance.Manage and coach team performance and wellbeing.Manage systems, licenses, budget, costs, and technology roadmap within the team scope.Ensure that the solutions follow Fortum policies and guidelines regarding architecture, development practices, privacy, security, etc.Collect functional and non-functional, security, compliance, and availability requirements from business units.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A bachelor's or master's degree holder in computer science, business administration, or another relevant area.Experienced in IT and function/business/industry.Experienced in leading teams.Experienced in SQL, Python, and data pipeline tools.Knowledge on Azure data tools like data factory, databricks, datalake is a plus.Maintaining role-based competence and training regularly.We are excited to hire an individual who is passionate about data platforms and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest.We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Azure Data Consultants Snsig
description: üöÄ Unlock Your Next Career Move with Our Growing Data Team! üöÄA company with over 20 years of experience, growing faster than ever. The Data Team, established under the leadership of an experienced team lead in 2021, has grown to 40 people and is rapidly expanding. We are focused on Azure-based analytics, and with a pipeline full of exciting projects, we need passionate, innovative professionals to join us!üîç What we're looking for:* 4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer focused on Azure Fabric, Databricks, DBT (Snowflake experience also considered)* Ideally, a Full Stack Data Engineer with expertise in DW, ETL, Data Modeling, and tools like Power BI - we'll consider backend-heavy profiles who are eager to work on the frontend when needed* Open-minded consultants who are excited to work with new tech and flexible on tools* Fluency in Finnish is a mustüíº Why join?* Flat hierarchy - A family feel where decisions are made together. Work closely with an experienced team lead and a team of consultants on cutting-edge Azure projects* New, innovative projects with clients across all industries, generating ‚Ç¨40M+ in revenue* Excellent salary & benefits with plenty of room for growth* Comprehensive training & certification opportunities - even if you're new to Azure, we'll support you in learning and growing* No legacy customers - All our work is cloud-based with the latest Azure technologies* Flexible working hours and a supportive work-life balance* Customer satisfaction rating of 4.6/5 consistently year on year!* Social & fun team culture - group outings, football games, and drinks with colleagues and customers (check out our fun team costumes on LinkedIn!)If you're looking for a dynamic and innovative team that values your expertise, fosters your growth, and offers exciting career opportunities, this is your chance! We're ready to expand and need talented Data Engineers to help us win and deliver even bigger projects this year.

description: Power BI ConsultantAre you passionate about data analytics and visualization? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can help businesses unlock the power of their data? If so, I have an exciting opportunity for you!My client is a rapidly growing consulting firm specializing in data and analytics solutions. Their mission is to help businesses across various industries leverage data-driven insights to enhance decision-making, improve efficiency, and drive innovation. As part of their expansion, they are looking for a talented Power BI Consultant to join the data team.Key Responsibilities:*Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.*Work closely with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into data solutions.*Optimize data models and visualizations to ensure efficiency and scalability.*Implement best practices for data visualization, data storytelling, and user experience.*Integrate Power BI with various data sources, including databases, cloud platforms, and APIs.*Provide training and support to clients on Power BI usage and best practices.*Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and industry experts.Requirements:*Proven experience in developing Power BI dashboards and reports.*Strong knowledge of DAX, Power Query, and data modelling.*Familiarity with SQL and relational databases.*Experience working with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.*Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.*Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.*Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.*Fluency in Finnish and English is a must.What They Offer:*A dynamic and supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth.*Exposure to cutting-edge projects in the field of data analytics and digital transformation.*Flexible working arrangements with a mix of remote and office-based work.*Competitive salary and benefits package.*The chance to work with a talented team of data professionals on impactful projects.If you are ready to take your career in Power BI consulting to the next level and work on exciting data-driven projects, I would love to hear from you!How to Apply: Send your CV outlining your experience and motivation for the role. title: Ai Principal Sssii
description: IMPACT DRIVEN, AI POWEREDJoin us at the forefront of the AI revolution. Our mission is to lead the transition towards a future where AI amplifies human potential, ensuring ethical and impactful use of technology!Our strategy is centered around three key areas:Staying on the cutting edge with the latest technical innovations, like Generative AI, which are set to transform our society in unprecedented ways, while continually developing our competencies.Transforming our own ways of working, focusing on reinventing the value chain and commercial models of software development through AI.Strengthening our ability to envision impactful and ethical Data & AI solutions for our customers to maximize our influence.AI PRINCIPALAs a Principal, you will be responsible for developing Siili's AI offerings, leading go-to-market activities, and acting as a trusted advisor for our customers. You will also inspire our own experts and act as a thought leader in AI.The specific skills we are seeking are:Broad understanding of various traditional and generative AI solutions, and the ability to identify business use cases while articulating business impact to stakeholders.Practical hands-on experience creating AI solutions, ideally from a data science or similar background, to provide practical implementation advice.Understanding of MLOps, related solutions, and/or data engineering.LIFE AS AI PRINCIPAL AT SIILIAs AI Principal, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:Developing your own offering and building external visibility through blog posts, public presentations, etc.Meeting customers, presenting Siili's perspectives, and generating leads.Collaborating with Siili's account managers to create sales pitches and proposals.Providing advisory services to our customers and overseeing project deliveries.Typically, your time will be split 50/50 between commercial/pre-sales and billable customer work.We believe that we can best help you build your story when you have:Strong business acumen and a clear understanding of how data and technology innovations create business value and competitive advantages for our customers.A curious mind and a deep understanding of the trends within your offering area.Exceptional communication skills in both conversation and writing, with an emphasis on pitching and delivering inspiring presentations.WHAT WE OFFERA supportive team environment: We uplift each other, treat everyone with respect, and strive to make each other better in all that we do.A community to grow, learn, and mentor: We invest in your skills development, and our combined design agency and tech powerhouse will help you stay at the cutting edge of the industry.Competitive compensation and benefits: We offer not only competitive pay but also additional perks like hobby clubs, daycare services for sick children.A profitable, growing company with a purpose: We have a clear vision and purpose, and a unique opportunity for you to make your mark as we shape the Data & AI story for a leading IT services company.If you're ready to be part of something transformative and impactful, we'd love to hear from you!WHY SIILI?At Siili, we're a community with a culture built on Joy, Ambition, and a Humane touch. We continuously organize activities and gatherings, enabling exciting projects with opportunities for learning, while fostering an inclusive and psychologically safe environment for everyone to express themselves.As a Siili, you'll work alongside the best colleagues on interesting client projects. We're committed to continuous growth, which means there are always opportunities for you to deepen your expertise while collaborating with Fullstack experts. We trust you to manage your own work while also contributing to diverse teams.We lead the charge in innovative projects that make a real-world impact, ensuring that AI is not just a tool but a transformative force in everything we do. We invest in the skills of each Siili through various paths of AI learning, certifications, and other development opportunities.We also offer an extensive range of great benefits, including healthcare, flexible working hours, in-house coaching, the SiiliX Share program, an employee bike benefit, and company-sponsored massage sessions. For a closer look at our vibrant company culture, we recommend following us on Instagram.READY TO "MAKE IT REAL"?At Siili, we don't conduct interviews; we have meetings. These meetings ensure that both our goals and expectations are aligned, laying the foundation for a promising future together.We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds, including different ages, genders, cultures, and minority groups.Please let us know if we can adapt our meeting to suit your needs. We strive to consider individual needs and neurodiversity in our recruitment process, making meetings as comfortable as possible for everyone.Apply today, and join us on this exciting journey!

title: Quantitative Senior Business Analyst For Nordea Finance Recovery Data Snsor
description: Would you like to play a key role in shaping the way credit risk recovery data is sourced in Nordea Finance? We are now looking for a Senior Business Analyst to understand business processes, design and implement data flows, and coordinate with other analysts and developers.The role requires both technical hands-on work and coordination with stakeholders. There is ample opportunity to take ownership and grow as the project develops, so we encourage both experienced and budding senior analysts to apply.At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast - and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That's why we're deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We're creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together - and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you'll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.About this opportunityWelcome to the Credit Risk Data Analytics team within Nordea Finance. We add value by enabling data driven credit risk management across the Nordics and across the product landscape of Nordea Finance.As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll play a valuable role in integrating Nordea Finance into the Nordea Groups centralized risk modelling, as we are modernizing the way recovery data is sourced.Credit risk models is a key priority for NF and the Nordea Group. Ensuring a robust and correct data foundation is a core aspect of the overall project and a non-trivial challenge.You will be a key person in analyzing requirements from Group Risk Models, understanding business processes and their representation in data, designing data flows and data quality monitoring, and interacting with IT architects and developers for the long term automation of recovery data sourcing. The initiative is evolving over the coming years and your skills and ideas will help shape our direction.What you'll be doing:Take ownership of and collaborate with other data analysts in maintaining and updating as-is data models and flows built in Python and SQLWork with other Credit Risk Management analysts and leaders in coordinating automation of recovery data sourcingAnalyse and understand our products and processes and how they are represented in legacy data modelsCreate robust and comprehensive integration of our data landscape with canonical data models of recovery dataCoordinate productionisation of prototypes with IT architects and developersBecome a subject matter expert in recovery data in Nordea Finance and act as a stakeholder towards both the local business and the groupYou'll join a diverse team in terms of age, experience, nationality and gender, situated across the Nordics. The role can be based in any of the Nordic capitals.Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best - and that we imagine you share with us.To succeed in this role, we believe that you:Have strong analytical skills - being able to understand complex processes and dataTake ownership of your work and are able to drive it independentlyAre analytical, methodical and structured with an eye for detailHave strong communication and collaboration skillsAre open and curious - seeking to learn and develop your skills and toolsetYour experience and background:Degree in a relevant field like economics, finance or other technical field (mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.)Experience with credit risk recovery data, for instance as a credit risk model analyst, as an analyst in a collection agency or from similar functions in the financial industry.Experience with SQL and PythonExperience with IT coordination would be a plusExcellent English, as this is our primary working languageIf this sounds like you, get in touch!Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 02/02/2025 . For more information, you're welcome to contact Tobias Sommer Thune on *** Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.Read more about working at Nordea here

title: Business Data Analyst With Product Owner Experience Group Credit Management Snsor
description: Would you like to be part of a Nordic team, developing the future credit processes for our customers? We are now looking for Credit Risk Business / Data Analysts to our High Risk Data & Default Management Team.We are offering you an exciting opportunity to develop key capabilities at the heart of Nordea. Your work will require you to understand the connection between regulatory requirements, business processes and data to pro-actively drive initiatives and solve complex problems connected to Nordea's Credit Risk process.About this opportunityWelcome to the High Risk Capability team. We are a growing team, driving the development for high risk credit processes (such as default management and early warnings). Our aim is to build sustainable processes and supporting tools that cater for automation through which we enable great customer experiences. You will work closely with team members and relevant stakeholders to drive the implementation of new solutions and processes for business, regulatory and data requirements.What you'll be doing:Building expertise of Nordea's credit risk agenda, especially within high riskBe part of an agile structure, with focus on defining, prioritizing and driving analysis and change initiatives from initiation to successful delivery, in close collaboration with development teams, relevant stakeholders and managementEnsuring our solutions meet business and regulatory requirements and maximize business valueIdentifying and actively proposing improvements to streamline the end to end credit processes and enable automation in the areaYou'll join a diverse, multi-faceted and passionate team. Occasional travel primarily in the Nordics should be expected. The location can be either in Sweden, Finland, Norway or Denmark.Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best - and that we imagine you share with us.Your experience and background:At least 3-5 years of experience working with data analysis and / or regulations and business processes within credit risk, preferably within high riskAs a business analyst you have experience driving change (from gathering business / regulatory requirements to implementation) in an agile environment. You also are strong in documenting and conceptualising requirements in complex environmentsFurthermore, you have experience working with and understanding credit risk related regulations, for example the Capital Requirements Regulation, EBA guideline on the definition of default or similarAs a data analyst you naturally have a passion for data, working independently with data analysis to produce actionable outcomes with key insights for stakeholdersHave a professional level of English, both written and spokenHave excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, building strong relationships with stakeholders across Business and ITTo succeed in the role, we believe that you:Can effectively deliver and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environmentAre self-going with a natural "can do" attitude, show ability to learn quickly and have a solution-oriented mindset supported by structured, analytical and creative thinkingIf this sounds like you, get in touch!Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 31/01/2025. For more information, you're welcome to contact Matthew Woodward, *** or ******.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.Only for candidates in Sweden:For union information, please contact *** or *** more about working at Nordea here

title: Vp Engineering Data Scsom
description: Upright is a rapidly growing impact data company on a mission to make it financially more attractive to run a net positive company than a net negative one. From the very beginning of 2017, we have been committed to highlighting what truly matters in corporate sustainability, producing data on companies' real-world impacts that's backed by science, comparable, and credible to inform better decision-making for companies, investors, customers, and beyond.Today, our Net Impact Platform is an exceptional resource - it's the world's largest open-access database on company and fund impact with data on 10,000+ companies and 35,000+ funds publicly available for anyone to explore. As impact data becomes increasingly central in business decision-making, Upright's data is trusted by 250+ institutional investment organizations and corporations, predominantly in Europe and North America. And this is just the beginning of our journey.We are now on the lookout for an experienced VP of Engineering (Data) who is ready and excited to take on the challenge of making Upright's impact data the world's leading impact resource. Your mission will be to drive the coverage, quality, relevance, and transparency of our impact data, ensuring that it becomes the go-to source for understanding companies' real-world impact.As the VP of Engineering (Data), you will lead Upright's data function, overseeing multiple teams responsible for developing our key datasets. You'll work with talented software engineers, data scientists, machine learning experts, and data analysts. Together, you'll push the boundaries of how our data can be used to measure impact at scale.SIGNS OF BEING A GREAT MATCH FOR THIS ROLE INCLUDE:Solid experience in leading high-performing engineering teamsComprehensive understanding of the whole software lifecycle including design, development, deployment, and operationsOverall understanding of modern data science and data engineering technologies, including data/ETL pipelinesHands-on experience in developing high-quality software with Typescript and PythonGood command of (Postgre)SQLAbility to understand complex data structuresAbility to think analytically, structure your work, and solve problems proactivelyAbility to communicate complex ideas clearly both verbally and in writingA proven track record of exceeding expectations, driven by an internal passion for excellenceA sense of urgency and the drive to get things doneStrong common-sense reasoning ability coupled with the ability to prioritize work effectivelyWHAT WE OFFER:A chance to join a quickly growing and highly ambitious impact SaaS company with a mission that mattersA fun and kind team with exceptional people who care about what they doExciting professional growth opportunitiesCompetitive compensation, including stock options and a comprehensive healthcare packageLocation: Helsinki, Finland.Deadline: Candidates will be reviewed on a continuous basis and the role will be filled as soon as the right person is found.>MISSION THAT MATTERSUpright is on a mission to incentivize companies to optimize their net impact by enabling science-based decision-making for investors, customers, employees, and public sector agents. To do that, Upright develops a proprietary data model based on an open-access database of 200M+ scientific articles and artificial intelligence to quantify the net impact of companies on people, planet, society, and knowledge creation. In addition to net impact, Upright produces data on UN SDG alignment, EU taxonomy, and EU SFDR PAI indicators. Currently, our impact data platform is used by 250+ institutional investors and companies, such as Nasdaq, Nordea, EQT and Nokia.If you have any questions, please email us at ***.

title: Open Application For Data Ai Sssii
description: MAKE YOUR STORY REALSiili is at the forefront of AI-powered development, and we are always looking for talented individuals to join our team. If you are passionate about data and AI, we want to hear from you! Whether you are a Data Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or have expertise in other related fields, we welcome open applications for our Data & AI roles.Why Siili? ü¶îAt Siili, you will collaborate with AI-assisted developers and designers on projects that go beyond proof-of-concept, delivering real-world impact and innovation. Our own AI transformation uniquely positions us as the ideal partner to guide our clients through their AI journeys. We are currently supporting leading organizations like Microsoft and Yle in their AI transformations. AI represents the next industrial revolution, and Siili is ready to lead the charge in digital development, making the most of the transformative power of AI.What We Offerü§ùInteresting and Impactful Work:You will work on exciting client projects that make a real difference. From building scalable data pipelines and implementing machine learning solutions to solving real-life business challenges with modern data solutions, your work will have a significant impact.Growth Ecosystem:At Siili, we believe in continuous growth. You can always deepen your expertise alongside our Data & AI experts. We offer various tracks for skill development.Flexible Working Environment:Our ways of working are tailored around you, allowing for flexibility to fit each individual's life situation. You will work in diverse teams while still managing your own work - we trust you!Collaborative & Inclusive Culture:You will have the opportunity to work with the best colleagues (Siilis) on interesting client projects. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment.What Are We Looking For?üéØWe are interested in professionals with experience in various Data & AI roles, including but not limited to:Data Engineers:hands-on coding experience with data-intensive solutions, experience with cloud platforms, and knowledge of data modelling methods.Machine Learning Engineers:Strong data science and machine learning expertise, Python programming skills, experience with cloud-based development, and proficiency in Finnish.Data Scientists:Advanced analytical skills, experience with machine learning libraries, and a strong understanding of data science methodologies.Shall We Get to Know Each Other Better?üí¨At Siili, we don't have interviews, we have meetings. With two meetings, we ensure together that both our goals and expectations are aligned, laying the foundation for a great future together.We hope to receive applications from individuals with various backgrounds, including different ages, genders, and cultural or minority groups. Please let us know if we can adjust our meeting according to your needs. We aim to consider individual needs and neurodiversity in our recruitment process, and to make meetings as comfortable as possible for everyone.WE MAKE IT REAL

We are currently supporting leading organizations like Microsoft and Yle in their AI transformations.AI represents the next industrial revolution, and Siili is ready to lead the charge in digital development, making the most of the transformative power of AI.Read more about our projects here.Interested in becoming a Machine Learning Engineer at Siili?ü¶îAs a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work together with our Data Engineers and Data Scientists of the Data Science Tribe to help our wide range of customers in taking their AI-capabilities to the next level. Your role will be a combination of building good data flow between different systems and implementing machine learning solutions and pipelines utilizing cloud-based or open-source machine learning stacks. You will become an expert in deploying machine learning solutions and in all that follows: we call this machine learning operations or in other words MLOps.To succeed in this role, you should have:üéØAt least one year (preferably 2+) of experience working as a cloud developer, data engineer, ML engineer or data scientist in a product company or as a consultantStrong knowledge of data science and machine learning conceptsGood Python skills and knowledge of Python machine learning libraries, like: Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, PandasExperience of cloud-based development (AWS, Google Cloud or Azure)SQL skillsKnowledge of development tools like Git, Docker, and VS CodeFluent Finnish skillsAdditionally, it is beneficial if you have:Experience in deploying machine learning systems into productionExperience with A/B testingExperience with databases, data warehouses, and ETL/ELT processesKnowledge of Spark, DatabricksFamiliarity with DevOps, MLOps, CI/CDKnowledge of Generative AI toolsWhyto ChooseSiili?ü§ùSiili is a partner in design, data, and AI-driven software development, specializing in recommendation engines and personalization solutions for digital business clients in media, retail, gaming, and entertainment. We optimize customer data through conversion optimization, customer segmentation, A/B testing, predictive models, and time series analysis. Our Data Scientists and ML Engineers tackle challenges across industries like healthcare, energy, manufacturing, insurance, banking, and maritime, using techniques such as computer vision, NLP, deep learning, optimization, and Bayesian modeling. As an ML Engineer, you are a key part of Siili's core team.We provide a culture and environment withJoy, AmbitionandHumanetouch. This means that we continuously organize different kinds of activities and gatherings, strive to enable exciting projects with learning opportunities, and continuously work on creating a work environment that is inclusive and psychologically safe for everyone to express themselves.You will have the opportunity to work with the best colleagues (Siilis) on interesting client projects. You will never be bored:we believe in continuous growth, meaning you can always deepen your expertise alongside our Data Science experts. Being a Siili means you get to work in diverse teams while still managing your own work - we trust you!A variety ofgreat fringe benefits; such as extensive healthcare, flexible working hours, snacks, inhouse coach, SiiliX Share program, employee bike benefit, and company-sponsored massage.Discover more about our benefits here , and get to know our team through these inspiring career stories . For a closer look at our vibrant company culture, we also recommend following us on Instagram .Shall we get to know each other better?üí¨At Siili, we don't have interviews, we have meetings. With two meetings, we ensure together that both our goals and expectations are aligned, laying the foundation for a great future together.We hope to receive applications from individuals with various backgrounds, including different ages, genders, and cultural or minority groups. Please let us know if we can adjust our meeting according to your needs. We aim to consider individual needs and neurodiversity in our recruitment process, and to make meetings as comfortable as possible for everyone.WE MAKE IT REAL

title: Backend Engineer Scala Partner Tech Scsom
description: Zalando together with partners fulfill more than 200 million orders every year and the volumes are increasing. Whenever a customer places an order, technology is at the scene and behind the scenes - software makes our systems work.As aBackend Engineerin Zalando Partner Tech, you will get to build this software and innovate, optimize and automate how our systems work on a massive scale. You will be responsible for developing and operating in production backend microservices using Scala, AWS, Kubernetes and we will support you to grow and work with exciting modern technologies.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategyOur employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groupsWHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDEDPartner Tech provides a technical ecosystem where partners can connect to and sell at Zalando. Our team builds and operates a subset in this domain building business-critical services which partners use to fulfill orders placed by Zalando customers.Build and operate an ecosystem where our partners can use our tools, services and APIs to handle orders placed by Zalando customersTogether with your team, you will own your code and decide on the technologies and methods to deliver, as well as operate large-scale applications Cloud PlatformsActively participate in each stage of the development cycle as part of a strong engineering team - from solution design to implementation, testing, monitoring and operating your code in a production environment.Perform code reviews, share knowledge and provide constructive feedback to team members.Actively participate in team discussions, design decisions and requirements clarifications with stakeholders and product managersYou keep learning and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate fasterWHAT WE'RE LOOKING FORSolid command of Scala and knowledge of software patterns and paradigms like continuous integration, test automation and deployment pipelines.Experience in specifying, planning, developing, maintaining and operating microservices using REST API (OpenAPI), Cloud Platforms (AWS, Kubernetes), PostgreSQL.Experience or interest in Java, Kotlin, web frontend technologies (React, Vue, Micro Frontend Architecture) is a plus.High level knowledge or interest in data engineering and familiarity with DAGs, data pipelines, S3, Superset, Databricks, or Airflow is a plus.You have good communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working in an international and diverse environment with a positive no-job-is-beneath you attitude as a team playerYou are self-motivated and have a proactive mindset with a passion for continuous improvement.You have problem-solving skills and ability to apply logical and analytical thinking to complex problemsIf you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.OUR OFFERCulture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback with internal guilds and Employee Resource Groups, knowledge sharing through tech talks and open source commitment, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, meetups, parties and events.Competitive salary and employee shares program.40% Zalando discount of products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge and additional discounts from external partnersMonthly transport, lunch and recreation vouchers, private health insurance and occupational health care services, family services, free beverages and snacks, diverse sports and health offeringsCentrally located office in Kamppi, Helsinki, with flexible working times, additional holidays and hybrid working modelExtensive onboarding, mentoring and training opportunities and an international team of experts to work withRelocation assistance for internationalsLearn all about Zalando and our values here: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us. For more information about our office and teams in Helsinki, please visit: https://www.zalandohelsinki.com/Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Data Scientist Snsit
description: BrieflyPositionFull Stack Data ScientistLocationHelsinki or TampereSkillsMachine learning, data engineering, data repositories, computing environments, cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), databases, software engineering (e.g. Python, R)KuvausAre you passionate about data and machine learning? Do you want to build solutions that create actual business value? At Nitor, we help our clients to succeed with data.üßë‚ÄçüöÄYour future roleAs a full stack Data Scientist, you will be creating business value to our customers by helping them to make better business decisions based on data. Your tasks will require both strong data engineering and data science skills.Communication with the customer is crucial. For example, you understand when the problems are better to solve with machine learning and when it‚Äôs not, and you will be communicating these decisions efficiently. Training our customer‚Äôs experts to use and maintain the provided solution is also part of your job.From a technology point of view, different data repositories, computing environments and data handling tools are part of your daily tools. Cloud services like AWS and Azure and programming languages like Python or R are also important in the full stack Data Scientist role.Our customer projectsare typically challenging yet professionally rewarding. The projects provide an experienced Data Scientist with the possibility to widely utilize and deepen their skill set. The duration of the projects usually ranges between one year and multiple years, depending on your preferences. Our data business unit Nitor Insight, established in 2018, is a tight-knit and startup-like community with an exceptionally high level of data know-how.‚úÖ What makes you successful as a Full Stack Data Scientist at Nitor?Previous work experience in data science. Consulting experience is a bonus but not a strict requirement.A few years of hands-on experience in data engineering, allowing you to work in your customer projects as a value-adding expertBased on your previous experience, you are familiar with the most of the following: machine learning, data repositories, computing environments, cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), databases, programming, software engineering (e.g. Python, R)You possess a consultative and customer-centric mindsetYou are also willing to work as a data engineer, when neededProfessional proficiency in Finnish is considered an advantageMost importantly: you are passionate about data science, and you actively follow the newest developments in the industryüèÜ Why should you choose Nitor?A set of benefits that makes a differenceIn addition to meaningful projects and customized possibilities for professional development, we offer you a profound set of employee benefits. Nitor is built in a way that it can support your career development, sustainable work pace, and well-being.Here are some examples of our employee benefits:You can use 10% of your work time for your professional development however you choose, and your employer will support it.Would you like to participate in an exciting event in your field? You can use up to five workdays a year for training or conference trips anywhere in the world.You will have your personal, monthly updated "iron bank" consisting of 7.100‚Ç¨ which you can freely use to acquire preferred work tools and home office supplies.You will get full holidays from the beginning of your employment, no matter what time of the year you start.Full culture and sports benefits, massage benefit, and commuting and bicycle benefitsA 500-2000‚Ç¨ bonus for each professional certificate you completeAn extensive set of health benefits with health insurance, covering special healthcare, dental care, and psychological support, among othersWe cherish our sense of community with our yearly employee trips (we have been, e.g., to Pisa, Berlin, Vienna, Edinburgh, and Dubrovnik, as well as the skiing centers of the North), seasonal events, and weekly get-togethers and breakfasts. You're welcome to join our running club, wine tasting, movie nights, HIIT training, or board game club, among others!Our way of working is grounded in trust, openness, and mutual respect; each Nitorean brings their unique quality to the company. We value and cherish our differences and the added value this brings to our customers.About your future employerAt Nitor, we don‚Äôt just build digital solutions; we create lasting success stories in collaboration with our clients. Sustainability is at the heart of our approach, ensuring that the systems, communities, environments, and processes we develop stand the test of time. This is what we call sustainable digital development.Our 250+ experts operate across Helsinki, Tampere, and Stockholm, combining diverse talents to deliver meaningful impact. Recognized as a Great Place to Work and awarded Finland‚Äôs Most Magnetic Employer Brand (read more), we take pride in our employee-driven culture and genuine commitment to our people's growth. We don‚Äôt just work together; we grow together. Your ideas and expertise will have a real impact, shaping both Nitor‚Äôs future and your career.Our vision is clear: to be the top choice for professionals in the field, driven by the happiness and empowerment of our people and customers. As a benchmark for customer satisfaction in the IT industry, Nitor continues to achieve growth and deliver outstanding customer results (read how dedication fuels our growth).üèñNitor's recruitment processOur recruitment process reflects our values and is a clear dialogue with four stages. You will have the possibility to meet at least four Nitoreans during the process. We offer you everything you need to know when deciding on your next workplace.1. Get to know Nitor: We map what is most important to you in your career. Our People Partner and our Principal Data Scientist / Managing Director will tell you about Nitor, our projects, and what your work at Nitor could look like.2. A technical interview: You will meet two of our consultants, who will form an understanding of the strengths and extent of your expertise. You will also gain first-hand knowledge of our projects and Nitor as an employer.3. Open questions: We double-check that you have all the answers to your possible questions. We specify your future role at Nitor and prepare the basis for your upcoming job offer.4. Presenting the offerSounds promising? Would you like to join our community of data professionals, coders, designers, and agile coaches and get to enjoy a creative and bureaucracy free working culture? Submit your application, let us know why Nitor and consulting would be an interesting next career step for you, and let's talk more!Also, please note that you will need to be authorized to work in Finland or Sweden in order to proceed in our recruitment process.Nitorilla √§√§nesi kuullaanNitor haluaa tarjota tekij√∂illeen parhaan mahdollisen paikan kasvaa ja kehitty√§ alansa ammattilaisena.
